description.narrative:
The future of the dairy sector in Kenya is in processed milk. This therefore calls Kabete Dairy to develop a long-term strategy to move from sale of raw milk to processed. Current milk sales / day is 12.500 kg of which only 4% is processed. KDFCS aim is to change its strategy to aligh with government as well as ensuring a sustainable business for the farmer hence future strategies will focus on expanding the sales of processed milk to make themselves future proof. At the same time expansion of milk the milk intake with 35% (end goal for 2017) . Therefore, the partnership between Kabete Dairy and Agriterra focuses on two objectives: 1) Increasing productivity and milk intake of Kabete dairy through organized extension 2) Transform from sale of raw milk to pasteurized milk by increasing volume of pasteurized to atleast 15% from the current 5%
Key focus on this action plan focuses on increasing production through establishing and organizing the extension department while improving the sales point through installation of modern technology(3 milk ATM) so as to increasing the sales of the orgganization
1) Increasing productivity and milk intake of Kabete dairy through organized extension 2) Transform from sale of raw milk to pasteurized milk by increasing volume of pasteurized to atleast 15% from the current 5%
